headline: Dr. Oz leads Pa. GOP Senate primary poll, large group still undecided
author: George Stockburger
sentences: The group’s polling methodology consists of a nine question questionnaire using live callers, integrated voice response, text messages, emails, and other proprietary digital methods not disclosed by the group.
While Oz led the crowded GOP field with 27.4 percent, 21.6 percent of likely Republican voters were still undecided on who to vote for with about three months until the primary.
The poll, conducted by The Trafalgar Group, interviewed 1,070 likely Pennsylvania Republican voters and found Oz with an 11.5 percent lead over businessman David McCormick.
(WHTM) – A new poll released on Monday shows television host Dr. Mehmet Oz with an early lead in the race to represent Pennsylvania in the United States Senate.
Former Danish Ambassador Carla Sands was third among the candidates with 14.8 percent, followed by Kathy Barnette and Jeff Bartos.
The Trafalgar Group says the poll was conducted with 95 percent confidence and a 2.99 percent margin of error.
Less than 18 percent of those interviewed were 18-44 years old and 87.6 percent of respondents were white.
An exact breakdown of how each age group, gender, and ethnicity responded to the poll was not released.
The majority of people interviewed were 45-64, followed closely by the 65 and older age group.
Sean Gale, George Bochetto, and Everett Stern each finished with less than two percent.
A majority of respondents (53.2 percent) were male.
